cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 425 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the central Gulf, forecast to turn north and then north-northeast toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast between Cameron and Morgan City, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX eastward to Ocean Springs, MS with greatest impacts across the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph) with higher gusts possible Friday afternoon through early Saturday; hurricane-force winds not expected but cannot be ruled out if the core shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft of inundation possible from Port Fourchon to the mouth of the Mississippi River, encompassing Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts; risk of flash and urban flooding Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday; dangerous surf/rip currents ahead of landfall.
